comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

Using alt-tab to switch to an other program and switch back to Firefox.


Actual results:

Firefox shows the website but the other program appears when moving the cursor.


Expected results:

Firefox should not show any other programs.

comments.text: Does it work if you disable the hardware acceleration under (alt key)/tools/options/advanced/general followed by a restart ?
comments.raw_text: Does it work if you disable the hardware acceleration under (alt key)/tools/options/advanced/general followed by a restart ?

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:8.0a1) Gecko/20110815 Firefox/8.0a1

I cannot reproduce the issue.
Please try and start Firefox on a new clean profile:
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Managing-profiles
Also try starting Firefox in safe-mode:
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode
Thanks!

comments.text:
It also happens with 3.6.19 and in combination with Thunderbird 6.0. Flash overlays also.

It is difficult to test and reproduce because it happens random. I'm trying to analyse the situation when it happens to find the cause.

Now I'm using FF 3.6.20 with Thunderbird 6.0 and will upgrade to the Firefox 6.
